question: Lencho compared the larger raindrops and smaller  raindrops to:
options: ten cent pieces and five cent pieces.
twelve cent pieces and two cent pieces.
twenty cent pieces and five cent pieces.
ten cent pieces and six cent pieces.

question: Which option correctly depicts Lencho’s state of mind  according to the following statement?  “Lencho showed not the slightest surprise on seeing  the money.”
As Lencho counted the money in the envelope, what  did he think to himself?
options: Neither could God make a mistake nor the post  office staff.
Neither could God make a mistake nor could He  deny Lencho’s request.
He thought he himself had made some mistake  while counting.
He was contented on seeing the money in the  envelope and thanked God.

question: Whenever the young Seagull thought to take a flight,  he felt certain that ___________.
options: he’ll drown in the sea beneath.
his siblings would make fun of him.
his wings would not support him.

question: His siblings had already flown away the day before but  he had been afraid to fly with them. Why?
options: He had shorter wings than them.
He could not muster up the courage to take the  flight.
He liked to sit back in the little hole under the ledge.

question: Complete the statement with appropriate choice.  ‘The pilot was flying his old Dakota aeroplane over  ____ back to_____.’
How did the pilot feel as he went behind the strange  aeroplane?
Complete the statement with appropriate choice.  After the __________, ______ had erected a system of  racial domination against the dark-skinned peoples of  their own land.
options: Birth of Mandela, White-Skinned Peoples of South  America
World War II, White-Skinned Peoples of South  Africa
World War I, Members of Congress Party, South  Africa
Bitter Anglo-Boer war, White-Skinned Peoples of  South Africa

question: According to Mandela, the twin obligations include:
options: Obligations to his family, his community and country.
Obligations to his people, his community and  country.
Obligations to his family, his wife and children.
Obligations to his wife, his parents and family.

question: Why does Anne Frank initially consider writing in a  diary, a really strange experience for someone like  her?
options: She had not written anything before.
She feels, later no one will be interested in reading  the diary of a thirteen-year-old schoolgirl.

question: In the summer of 1941, why was Anne’s birthday not  celebrated enthusiastically?
options: Everybody was mournful as her grandmother had  died.
Her Grandma had an operation and was ill.
She didn’t have many friends in Holland.

question: Why was Anne’s entire class ‘quaking in its boots’?   It was because of ….
options: teachers, meeting to discuss the students, concern.
students, meeting to raise their complaints.
teachers, meeting to determine the students,  results.
students, meeting to decide the characters of a play.

question: The poem ‘Quack, Quack, Quack, Said Mistress  Chatterbox’ was about:
options: a mother and a father duck with three baby  ducklings.
a mother and a father duck with two baby ducklings.
a father duck who ate the mother with three baby  ducklings.
a mother duck and a father swan with three baby  ducklings.

question: How many pairs of shoes did Wanda say she had?
Maddie started writing a note to Peggy but suddenly  she paused and shuddered because:
options: She imagined herself in the school yard as a new  target for Peggy and the girls.
She imagined herself at Wanda’s home as a new  target for Peggy and the girls.
She imagined Peggy in the schoolyard as a new  target for Wanda and the girls.
She imagined Wanda at Maddie’s home as a new  target for Peggy and the girls.

question: Pick out the option which describes the dresses that  Wanda claimed to have.
options: Brilliant blue with trimmings and pale green with a  red sash.
Pale blue with coloured trimmings and jungle green  with a red sash.
Pale green with coloured trimmings and brilliant red  with a green sash.
Pale blue with coloured trimmings and printed  yellow with a red sash.

question: Complete the statement with appropriate choice.  ‘In boys category, _________ had won for his design of  _________.’
On reading out the letter from Wanda’s father, Miss  Mason expressed what emotions to the students?  She felt ___
options: it was an unfortunate and illegal thing to have  happened.
it was a sad and illegal thing to have happened.
it was a miserable and unethical thing to have  happened.
it was an unfortunate and sad thing to have  happened.

question: What did Peggy and Maddie think when they didn’t  get a revert for their letter to Wanda?
options: She was arrogant and moody so she would not  answer.
She was jealous and cunning so she would not  answer.
She was so hurt and angry that she would not  answer.
She was so unwilling and disinterested that she  won’t answer.

question: Pick out the option where Griffin did not go after  turning invisible.
options: A shop in Drury Lane, the centre of the theatre  world.

question: What did Griffin do to Mr. Jaffers?
options: He fought with Mr. Jaffers but in vain.

question: What all tasks did Hari Singh do for Anil?
The first meal Hari Singh cooked for Anil was:

How did Tricki appear to Mr. Heriott when he saw him  at the street with his mistress?  Pick out the best option that follows: (1) Like a bloated sausage with a leg at each corner. (2) Eyes bloodshot and rheumy. (3) Tongue lolling from his jaws. (4) Paws puffed and ears shrunken. (5) Very energetic and nimble footed .
What reason did Mrs Pumphrey give on not being able  to cut down Tricki’s sweets intake?  She felt ________
options: Tricki had turned weak and also that he loved  chocolates.
Tricki would run away if not fed sweets.
Sweets were helping Tricki to stay active.

question: Lencho was _______when he said ‘A plague of locusts  would have left more than this.”
The Post master’s intention of helping Lencho was to  ___________
options: help him in his difficult time.
help him to grow the crop again.
do some charity for his own satisfaction.

question: What does Nelson Mandela mean by comparing man’s  goodness to a flame?  He feels that there is ______________
options: a burning desire for freedom among his people.
a glimmer of humanity in everyone.

question: In the poem, 'Dust of Snow' what does the symbolic  representation of an unglamorous tree like hemlock  tree and a lackluster bird like crow mean?
options: It shows us the unpleasant aspects of nature.
It impresses upon us the glory of nature even in the  most humble and unglamorous aspects.
It highlights the ugliness of human heart.
It represents the poet’s depressive state of mind.

question: When the young seagull pretended to fall asleep, he  wanted to _______
options: show his resentment due to hunger.
draw sympathy of his family members.

question: Identify the motivational factor behind the first flight  of the young seagull.
options: His strong urge to eat the fish.
Encouraged to see his sibling fly.

question: In the poem ‘Fire and Ice’, what is the tone of the poet  when he calls the ice ‘great’?
Identify the option that aptly describes Hari Singh.
Why is the narrator tempted to keep Tricki as a  permanent guest?
options: He thought Mrs. Pumphrey wouldn't take good care  of Tricki.
They would lose all luxuries like eggs, wine and  brandy.

question: A change in the present condition of mind expressed  by the poet in the poem ‘Dust of Snow’ is ___________.
In the poem “Dust of Snow” the poet uses ‘Hemlock’  and ‘Crow’ to represent.
In the poem ‘Fire and Ice’, which two scenarios are used  by the poet aligning with fire and ice to end the world?
The poet wishes for the tiger to be ‘sliding’ through the  foliage as this would:
options: assist in keeping the prey unsuspecting of the  predator’s sound.
aid in camouflaging the presence of the predator  before it rushes in.
help the predator pounce on the prey comfortably  without getting tired.
support the predator’s vision as it eyes its prey.

question: Which fact dose not connect with the significance of  the water hole for the tiger?
options: Many tigers chase prey into the water and holds the  victim’s head under water until it drowns.
Prey feed in the water on water-lilies, and often  wander into the middle of the water hole, where  they are vulnerable and easy for the tiger to kill.
Prey that has quenched its thirst ensures  consumption of hydrated meat for the tiger.
Chasing the panicked prey from shallow to deep  water where the tiger grabs it.

question: According to the poet, how should the tiger walk  through grasses?
The line in The Ball Poem ‘No one buys a ball back’ indicates that the boy learns____________.
How did Griffin escape from the assistants?
options: by removing his newly worn clothes

question: In The Ball Poem the unique theme used by the poet is  ______________.
In the story, ‘A Letter to God’, the dialogue “All our  work, for nothing!” “There is no one who can help us!”  proves how ___________the outcome of the calamity  was.
Which option correctly states how Lencho felt when  he thinks “The eyes of God see everything even what is  deep in one’s conscience”? He felt like a ____________.
Mandela speaks of the wound of racial discrimination.  The word used to describe it is__________.
The oppressed and the oppressor alike are robbed of their  humanity. By this Mandela meant that_________.
options: the oppressor is the prisoner and is free.
the oppressor is the free man and is oppressed.
the oppressed desires freedom from the oppressor.
the oppressor is as much a prisoner as the oppressed.

question: What are the two negative feelings the young seagull  had?
options: afraid of the water, low self esteem
afraid of height, not confident on strength of his  wings
afraid of his parents, jealous of his siblings
lazy to fend for food, afraid of heights

question: Identify the option that aptly describes the young  seagull at first.
What are the two specific words that show the aspects  used in order to encourage the seagull?
In the lesson The Black Aeroplane, what does it mean  by ‘I was starting to feel frightened again’?  It indicates that the narrator was:
What must have been the reaction of the narrator  when he did not see the pilot who helped him arrive  safely without a compass, radio and without any more  fuel in his tanks?
What does Anne mean by ‘quaking in its boots’?
Anne always considered teachers to be the most  ____________ creatures.
Then, sometimes, they waited for Wanda — ‘to have  fun with her’. What do these words indicate?
She usually wore somebody’s ‘hand-me-down’ clothes.  What does ‘hand-me-down’ best indicate?
Everybody listened closely as Miss Mason read the brief  note indicates that of:
What did Wanda express by saying ‘the teacher does  not equalize with you’ in the letter to Miss Mason?
options: Miss Mason was an exemplary teacher.
Miss Mason was a strict teacher.

question: Lencho compared the quantum of damage with the  _____________.
What unintended effect did the decades of oppression  and brutality had?
options: Created men of extraordinary courage, wisdom and  generosity.

question: Man who takes away another man's freedom is _____.
The word 'resilience' means:
options: the ability to deal with any kind of hardship.
the ability to conquer the foe.

question: "The structure they created formed the basis of one  of the harshest, most inhumane, societies the world  has ever known." What structure is Mandela talking  about?
"They looked like black mountains standing in front of me  across the sky". What looked like black mountains?
What did the seagull pretend was happening to him  before taking his first flight?
options: He was falling down the cliff.

question: How would you describe the ‘risk’ the narrator took in  the chapter “Black Aeroplane”?
The word ______ means the ability to invent things and  solve problems in the clever and new way.
Miss Mason said, "look at her exquisite drawings". What  is the meaning of "Exquisite"?
Regarding Wanda being teased, Miss Mason was  ________.
options: in denial that such behaviour was possible by her  students.
aware, but didn’t want to discuss it with the students.
unaware that the students were frequently teasing  Wanda.
of the belief that such behaviour was a normal part  of growing up.

question: When the teacher wants them to ‘file around’ in the  lesson “The Hundred Dresses I’’, she wants the students  to………….
options: put the files in their proper places.
gather around her table to discuss the designs.
file the designs properly in their folders.
walk in a line to admire the designs.

question: Name the poetic device used in the line ‘and saved  some part’.
Name the poetic device used in the line "He stalks in  his vivid stripes".
Why does the poet choose not to intrude the child in  The Ball Poem?  This is so because the poet:
options: knows that it would embarrass the boy in his  moment of grief.
feels that it’s important that the boy learns an  important life lesson, undisturbed.
doesn’t have money to buy a new ball for the boy.
experiences a sense of distress himself, by looking at  the boy’s condition.

question: Peggy and Maddie waited for Wanda ‘to have fun with  her’ which means that they wanted _______
options: to crack some jokes on her.
to spend a pleasant time with her.

question: In the poem ‘A tiger in the zoo’, what does ‘his strength  behind the bars’ indicate?  It indicates that now_________
options: he does not long for freedom.

question: By ‘Ignoring visitors’, the tiger wants to show his:
‘Half the class is making bets.’ What were Anne’s  classmates making bets on?  They were making bets on_______
options: how beautifully one can write an essay.
who would pass and who would fail.
Anne’s would stop talking or not.
Mr. Keesing would be annoyed or happy with Anne.

question: Why does Anne say that she does not have a friend?   She says so because_______
options: she does not have any friend.
she does not want to talk to others.
she does not find anyone close to her heart.

question: The pilot followed the black aeroplane like an obedient  child, because ________
options: this was his only chance for survival.
he was compelled to follow it.

question: The ending of the story ‘The Black Aeroplane’ comprises  the elements of _______.
In ‘The Ball Poem’, what does, ‘In the world of possession’ mean’?  It refers to _______.
In the line from ‘The Thief’s Story’ - ‘I might be able to  get into the young man’s confidence.’ Choose the option  that dose not display what the statement means.
options: He wanted to win his trust.
He wanted him to share his thoughts without  caution.
He wanted him to feel comfortable revealing more  details about himself.
He wanted to be able to spend quality time with  him.

question: What takes all the pleasure out of work?
options: when someone doesn’t notice that they’ve been  robbed.

question: What was Maddie reminded of by the Petronski's  house?
options: how she could stop all of it.

question: Which option correctly replaces the underlined phrase  in the given line from Fire and Ice?  From what I’ve tasted of desire.
In The Ball Poem, what does the phrase indicate?  No use to say ‘O there are other balls’ It means _____:
options: buying another ball would cheer up the boy.
he knows he’ll anyways get a new ball.
he had many other balls to play with.
buying another ball won’t make the boy happy again.

question: In the poem Dust of Snow, which words represent the  use of ‘rhyme’ poetic device?
In the poem A Tiger in the Zoo, pick out the phrase  which does not depict the tiger’s physical appearance?
Which option correctly replaces the underlined phrase  in the given line from Dust of Snow?  Of a day I had rued
In The Ball Poem, what does the phrase indicate?  'balls will be lost always'  It means:
options: balls bought are meant to be lost.
balls always get lost in the harbour there.
owning and losing things is a part of life.
the narrow street was the reason for balls being lost.

question: In the poem The Tiger of the Zoo, what does the phrase  indicate?  'Terrorising the village'  It means:
options: Village people are scared of the jungle’s tiger.
People are scared of the tiger in the zoo.
The jungle tiger is scared of villagers.
The tiger of the zoo likes the visitors.

question: In the poem Fire and Ice, what does the phrase indicate?  But if it had to perish twice  It means _____
options: if the world has to die again and again.
if the world has to struggle again.
if the world has to expire twice.
if the world can live more than twice.

question: In The Ball Poem, pick out the phrase which suggests  money or another ball cannot buy happiness for the  boy?
options: Merrily over — there it is in the water
A dime, another ball, is worthless.
His ball went. I would not intrude on him
And no one buy a ball back.

question: In the poem Dust of Snow, what does the phrase  indicate?  Shook down on me  It means:
options: crow made the snowfall on the poet.
speeding winds forced the snow to fall.
the snow randomly fell on the poet.
movement in the tree stems made the snowfall.

question: Which option correctly replaces the underlined phrase  in the given line from A Tiger in the Zoo?  He should be lurking in the shadow.
In the poem Fire and Ice, which words represent the  use of both ‘alliteration’ and ‘anaphora’ poetic devices?
Which option correctly replaces the underlined phrase  in the given line from The Ball Poem?  I would not intrude on him.
In the poem A Tiger in the Zoo, which phrase suggests  the tiger is getting ready to attack his prey?
options: Baring his white fangs, his claws.
He hears the last voice at night.

question: In The Ball Poem, where did the boy use to get his ball  lost since childhood?
“Brilliant scientist though he was, Griffin was rather a  _____ person.”
